comments.text:
Another unexpected side effect occurs when trying to select text from an input that has a hidden selection.

1. select all the text
2. click off the input
3. try to click drag to select a portion of the text

Instead of being able to make a new selection, you are now drag-and-dropping the previous selection.

This is exasperated when using tab to navigate inputs and inadvertently setting all of their hidden selections to the full text.

comments.text:
(In reply to Brian R. Bondy [:bbondy] from comment #6)
> Verified in input and textareas, and verified that the selection stays when
> unfocused on contenteditable fields. 
> 
> I'm not sure if this is something that is on purpose and by design though.
> IE, Chrome, Safari, and Opera do the same thing with not showing selections
> in these eleemnts when they are unfocused.

This comment is missing the point.  Although the other browsers may not show selection when unfocused, they also clear selection upon focusing.  Firefox does not.  Firefox only clears the selection if the action you take would clear it (clicking in whitespace or clicking in the center of the word).  Clicking and dragging on the text (see Vinny's comment) is proof that the selection is retained even upon focusing--and it's not desirable behavior.

IMO, the real bug is the drag issue, but the focus issue makes that worse.
